website_summaries.verdict: The unusual knit of the Eggsnow makes for a breathable, stretchy strap.
pros: The strap is quite long, to the benefit of taller photographers
The two-inch width ensures that it won't dig into your shoulder after hours of carrying, and the range of design options will satisfy anyone wishing to personalize their strap
cons: Knit material will soak up perspiration, so you'll need to wash it more frequently

customer_reviews.title: Best Inexpensive Camera Strap Yet...with modest changes made.
customer_reviews.text: This strap was so inexpensive that I didn't expect much. After reading the reviews, I made a couple of easy alterations. First, I removed the "cheesy" looking camera on the woven cloth by simply sliding some wire cutters under the plastic camera and squeezing slightly. The rivet popped free and was removed. The next thing is to throw away the two supplied "connect buckles." You don't need them and using them is just an accident waiting to happen. Connect the strap to the camera in the "tried and true" method as shown in my photo. The result is a great camera strap made even cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: NavyVet68

customer_reviews.title: The cloth is excellent but cheap plastic parts
customer_reviews.text: THE plastic that holds/adjusts the straps to he camera broke after I caries the camera around my neck for a week of vacation. The plastic pieces aren't well made and snapped under the weight. The cloth is excellent but cheap plastic parts. My camera fell to the ground and part of my lens broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Cirka

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Nice
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's 2" wide, soft and very long. I was concerned that it would be too course and be scratchy on my bare neck but just the opposite it's actually very soft and comfortable to wear. The braiding also helps it stay on your shoulder with out the need for a leather backing. It is surprisingly long too. I'm 6'2'' or 189cm and at maximum length my camera will hang just below my waist. I actually had to shorten my camera strap for a change.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Paden

customer_reviews.title: I'll be buying a different strap soon.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly as I thought it would be. But the little brass camera insignia is superfluous and prevents this strap from being washed easily. It's not removable (riveted to the strap). Who needs a little camera on their strap? Yes, we know it's for a camera. Believe me, this things gets soaked with sweat quickly and you'll need to wash it if you're a working photographer. Anyway, I'll be buying a different strap soon.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: What I was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had much of a chance to use it yet, but my initial impression is that it was just what I was looking for. Extra length allows camera to hang at my side while the strap around my neck assures it won't slip off my shoulder. Really like the extra width of the strap and the soft, comfortable material weave. Should be comfortable over many hours.
customer_reviews.author: Frogtowner

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Strap!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera strap to get for my new camera and found this knitted design. When I saw it, I got the idea to attach pins to it so I decided to order one. Definitely a good decision! It's durable, comfortable, and looks great with pins! I also like the wideness of the strap. It's similar to a guitar strap, not like the lanyard-like strap that came with my camera!
customer_reviews.author: Cka85

customer_reviews.title: So comfy
customer_reviews.text: I love this strap. It is quite long so it makes it very easy to move it around your neck. If you wanna carry your camera under your shoulder, behind your back or in the front while still having the ability to quickly grab it and shoot an image then you found what you're looking for, look no further. In addition, it's very soft so it doesn't bother you.
customer_reviews.author: DAG

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this strap. Currently using it on my Sony A7iii camera. The strap is kind of wider than the hole you connect it with on the camera but once you give it a good pull, it slides right in. I ended up cutting off the excess strap so they don’t dangle from the sides. The material is very durable and comfortable. I love this strap!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable on your neck
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Very comfortable on your neck. I could see how this could accumulate sweat, though. If it does get a smell, I would just throw in a delicate, cold wash then air dry. Or handwash then air dry. I love how adjustable it is. It can be very long, I use it as a cross-body all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Emily H.

customer_reviews.title: The width of the strap and the thick woven yarn make it very comfortable around the neck
customer_reviews.text: The strap is long enough to wear cross body. The width of the strap and the thick woven yarn make it very comfortable around the neck. I haven't had it long enough to speak about durability. This is a huge upgrade from straps that come with cameras. For reference I'm using this on a Nikon D750. It's also nice not having bold yellow lettering announcing to the world that I have an expensive camera.
customer_reviews.author: Parnone

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent comfortable soft strap. I didn’t use the quick disconnect clips and just attached it directly to the camera. Very soft and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: D. McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome strap very comfortable only one problem they put a metal camera emblem on strap that could scratch your camera screen just pry it off.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: ... my Nikon D300 & a Sigma 70-300mm lens very comfortable on my shoulder
customer_reviews.text: This Eggsnow knit strap is wide enough to support my Nikon D300 & a Sigma 70-300mm lens very comfortable on my shoulder. The strap maybe cheaper then more expensive camera straps but this Eggsnow delivers on quality!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this strap
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this strap! It had good reviews and I really wanted something all black but a little stylish and still durable. I was expecting it to be somewhat scratchy but it's actually the opposite and super soft and has a bit of stretch to it. The price was excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Strap!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and well made camera strap. Like some others I removed the little metal camera emblem for both looks and to get rid of the metal for its potential for scratches. I like the wide width and nice look in black.
customer_reviews.author: R. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the strap much yet, but it's super easy to use and slightly stretchy so it's very comfortable. It looks like high quality which is awesome for the price. I got the black knit strap.
customer_reviews.author: Heath A Tuma

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve received and installed it...I haven’t taken it out for long durations but my initial assessment, it’s damn great for the price. The material is soft and I see muse carrying a camera all day with no discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: K_P**02

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Crossbody Strap!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera strap! I wear it in a cross body style and it is so comfy for long wedding days. I was afraid it might not support the weight of my camera but it is made of very strong material.
customer_reviews.author: 2010cheer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very good for length adjustment, and strap is wide and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Boy

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality. Comfortable and flexible & good looking strap
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. Comfortable and flexible & good looking strap.
customer_reviews.author: mbna

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy and practical
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my partner because he was always complaining about sweating and general discomfort when using the strap that came with his fancy camera. This one is much more breathable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: lydkins33

customer_reviews.title: I like this strap a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this strap a lot. I use it all the time and find it comfortable, easy to adjust and classy looking. It was a good price and easy to attach.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: You can tell it's cheap but it's more comfortable than the strap that came with my camera
customer_reviews.author: Gumbs

customer_reviews.title: this is the best camera strap I have owned
customer_reviews.text: In 50 years as a photographer, this is the best camera strap I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: gary gruber

customer_reviews.title: I love my new strap
customer_reviews.text: I love my new strap! It's wider and made of a more comfortable/stretchy fabric than my Nikon strap. It looks nice and seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Rissa Wins

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wide & Soft Neck Strap!
customer_reviews.text: Nice wide and soft neck strap. Huge comfort difference from the stock Canon strap that I now use on my binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: K. Main

customer_reviews.title: That emblem has got to go!
customer_reviews.text: It's a shame the silly metal emblem can't be removed but overall a decent no frills strap. Already got rid of it though
customer_reviews.author: JRW74

customer_reviews.title: ... and does not cut into the neck or shoulder like most neck/shoulder straps
customer_reviews.text: It is broad around the neck and does not cut into the neck or shoulder like most neck/shoulder straps. I recommend it over the majority of straps.
customer_reviews.author: BillyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good shoulder strap that is comfortable due to the soft material they used. It has a nice little gold camera pin as shown in their picture and since the material is soft you can also put your own personal pins.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy but a bit too wide, which can cause you to sweat.
customer_reviews.author: D.K.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for any dslr camera
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and not hot in the sun all day wearing. The material allows for airflow thru it. Would recommend for any dslr camera.
customer_reviews.author: Skimman86

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and attractive strap. It is wider than most so you may have trouble clipping a lens cap holder on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dunay

customer_reviews.title: Wide strap
customer_reviews.text: Nice, wide, (widest that I could find) comfortable camera strap.
customer_reviews.author: D. Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love how comfortable the knit is. Its lightweight and breathable when around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Nice materials.
customer_reviews.text: Very soft on the neck and it doesn't get hot. Nice materials.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very nice well made and feels right
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel on the neck, well constructed and no over bearing. would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Love this strap. The length allows a lot of room for actually operating my dslr while strapped across the chest and under one arm.
customer_reviews.author: Irv the Swerve

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, comfortable on neck or shoulder and easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Tanisha Cook

customer_reviews.title: Nice Strap...
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade over the strap that came with the camera. Soft and long...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Have it on a canon rebel T5 and T6 nice adjustable lengths for what you are most comfortable with. Really nice having for long photography sessions expecially when I'm out hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice strap. A little too wide makes it somewhat uncomfortable after a while
customer_reviews.author: ron brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Long enough and very comfortable. Love the little camera pin!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stap is so beautiful - so soft and comfortable - easy to attach to camera. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft, cool, comfortable. Don't hesitate to buy one.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this neck strap and use it with a Lumix FZ-1000. As others have said, it's soft, slightly stretchy and comfortable. It also feels cooler during hot summer days because it's knitted and allows air circulation. And it looks nice. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. It's very comfortable, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than the Kit version, long enough and less bothering!
customer_reviews.author: Tahsin
